body_html: @VenkateshSatagopan The output from tf.image.decode_bmp() is correct and the number of channels should equal to 4. Basically, channel(=4) corresponds to RGBA whereas channel(=3) corresponds to RGB. Your image is RGBA where A denotes opacity.
body_text: @VenkateshSatagopan The output from tf.image.decode_bmp() is correct and the number of channels should equal to 4. Basically, channel(=4) corresponds to RGBA whereas channel(=3) corresponds to RGB. Your image is RGBA where A denotes opacity.
body: @VenkateshSatagopan The output from `tf.image.decode_bmp()` is correct and the number of channels should equal to 4. Basically, channel(=4) corresponds to RGBA whereas channel(=3) corresponds to RGB. Your image is RGBA where A denotes opacity.
